directions: Plant sugar cane plants in an appropriate climate and location.
Water the sugar cane plants regularly to ensure proper growth.
Allow the sugar cane plants to grow for approximately 9-12 months.
Harvest the sugar cane plants by cutting them at the base.
Remove the outer layer of the sugar cane stalks.
Extract the sweet juice from the sugar cane stalks using a press or juicer.
Boil the sugar cane juice to evaporate the water and concentrate the sugars.
Allow the concentrated sugar cane juice to cool and crystallize into raw sugar cane.
Further process the raw sugar cane into refined sugar by removing impurities and drying the crystals.
Package the refined sugar for storage and use in various recipes.
